title: Learner-Centered Online Mathematics Instructional Design Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of secondary mathematics curriculum and practical work experience
context.additional_context: Online mathematics instruction design capability development through project-based learning in smartphone-limited settings, applicable to real-world vocational contexts

learning_goals: Learners can utilize an online mathematics education design framework based on constructivist principles
Learners develop the ability to design learner-centered project-based assignments executable in smartphone environments

Learners can identify three practical issues (e.g., low learner engagement, limited content accessibility, inadequate assessment systems) that arise in the ODL (Online and Distance Learning) design process, propose at least two solution strategies for each issue, and demonstrate feasibility with an average score of 4 or higher (on a 5-point scale) through peer evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
